3 # Python libs
4 import sys

7 # numpy and scipy
8 import numpy as np
9 from scipy.ndimage import filters

11 import imutils
12 
13 # OpenCV
14 import cv2
15 
16 # Ros libraries
17 import roslib
18 import rospy
19 
20 # Ros Messages
21 from sensor_msgs.msg import CompressedImage
22 from geometry_msgs.msg import Twist
23 import std_msgs
24 from std_msgs.msg import Float64
25 from std_msgs.msg import Int32
26 VERBOSE = False
27 
28 global reached
29 global mirostate
30 mirostate = 1
31 reached = 1
32 
33 class image_feature:
34 
35  def __init__(self):
36  '''Initialize ros publishers, ros subscribers'''
37  rospy.init_node('image_feature', anonymous=True)
38  # topic where we publish
39  self.image_pub = rospy.Publisher("/robot2/output/image_raw/compressed",
40  CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
41  self.vel_pub = rospy.Publisher("robot2/cmd_vel",
42  Twist, queue_size=1)
43  self.ang_pub = rospy.Publisher("/robot2/joint1_position_controller/command",
44  Float64, queue_size=3)
45  self.detection_pub = rospy.Publisher("object_detection",
46  Int32, queue_size=3)
47  # subscribed Topic
48  self.subscriber = rospy.Subscriber("robot2/camera1/image_raw/compressed",
49  CompressedImage, self.callback, queue_size=1)
50 
51  self.substate = rospy.Subscriber("miro_state",
52  Int32, self.statecallback, queue_size=1)
53 
54  def statecallback(self, data):
55  """Callback to miro read state from a topic
56 
57 
58  """
59  global mirostate
60  mirostate = data.data
61 
62  def callback(self, ros_data):
63  '''Callback function of subscribed topic.
64  Here images get converted and features detected
65  If the ball is detected a message will be setn to the state machine
66  when the state machine will commute to the PLAY state the function will send
67  cmd_vel msg to the robot'''
68  if VERBOSE:
69  print ('received image of type: "%s"' % ros_data.format)
70 
71  #### direct conversion to CV2 ####
72  np_arr = np.fromstring(ros_data.data, np.uint8)
73  image_np = cv2.imdecode(np_arr, cv2.IMREAD_COLOR) # OpenCV >= 3.0:
74 
75  #range of color for the segmentation
76  greenLower = (50, 50, 20)
77  greenUpper = (70, 255, 255)
78 
79  blurred = cv2.GaussianBlur(image_np, (11, 11), 0)
80  hsv = cv2.cvtColor(blurred, cv2.COLOR_BGR2HSV)
81  mask = cv2.inRange(hsv, greenLower, greenUpper)
82  mask = cv2.erode(mask, None, iterations=2)
83  mask = cv2.dilate(mask, None, iterations=2)
84  #cv2.imshow('mask', mask)
85  cnts = cv2.findContours(mask.copy(), cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL,
86  cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
87  cnts = imutils.grab_contours(cnts)
88  center = None
89 
90  global reached
91  # only proceed if at least one contour was found
92  if len(cnts) > 0 :
93  # find the largest contour in the mask, then use
94  # it to compute the minimum enclosing circle and
95  # centroid
96  c = max(cnts, key=cv2.contourArea)
97  ((x, y), radius) = cv2.minEnclosingCircle(c)
98  M = cv2.moments(c)
99  center = (int(M["m10"] / M["m00"]), int(M["m01"] / M["m00"]))
100  detected = Int32()
101  detected.data = 1
102  self.detection_pub.publish(detected)
103  #print ('mirostate: [%d]' % mirostate)
104  # only proceed if the radius meets a minimum size
105  if radius > 10 and mirostate == 2:
106  # draw the circle and centroid on the frame,
107  # then update the list of tracked points
108  cv2.circle(image_np, (int(x), int(y)), int(radius),
109  (0, 255, 255), 2)
110  cv2.circle(image_np, center, 5, (0, 0, 255), -1)
111  vel = Twist()
112  vel.angular.z = -0.002*(center[0]-400)
113  vel.linear.x = -0.01*(radius-100)
114  self.vel_pub.publish(vel)
115 
116  #rospy.loginfo('%d'%reached)
117  if vel.angular.z < 0.05 and vel.angular.z > -0.05 and vel.linear.x < 0.05 and vel.linear.x > -0.05 and reached == 0:
118  rospy.loginfo('Moving head')
119  vel.angular.z = 0
120  vel.linear.x = 0
121  self.vel_pub.publish(vel)
122  ang1 = Float64()
123  ang1.data = 0
124  self.ang_pub.publish(ang1)
125  time.sleep(2)
126  ang1.data = -0.7
127  self.ang_pub.publish(ang1)
128  time.sleep(2)
129  ang1.data = 0
130  self.ang_pub.publish(ang1)
131  time.sleep(1)
132  ang1.data = 0.7
133  self.ang_pub.publish(ang1)
134  time.sleep(2)
135  ang1.data = 0
136  self.ang_pub.publish(ang1)
137  #set reached to 1 to do the head movement just one time
138  reached = 1
139  elif vel.angular.z > 0.05 and vel.linear.x > 0.05 :
140 
141  reached = 0
142 
143  else:
144  if mirostate == 2:
145  #aligned
146  vel = Twist()
147  vel.linear.x = 0.5
148  self.vel_pub.publish(vel)
149  reached = 0
150 
151  else:
152  #green not found
153  """ vel = Twist()
154  vel.angular.z = 0.5
155  self.vel_pub.publish(vel)
156  reached = 0 """
157  detected = Int32()
158  detected.data = 0
159  self.detection_pub.publish(detected)
160  reached = 0
161 
162  cv2.imshow('window', image_np)
163  cv2.waitKey(2)
164 
165  # self.subscriber.unregister()
166 
167 
168 def main(args):
169  '''Initializes and cleanup ros node'''
170  ic = image_feature()
171  try:
172  rospy.spin()
173  except KeyboardInterrupt:
174  print ("Shutting down ROS Image feature detector module")
175  cv2.destroyAllWindows()
176 
177 
178 if __name__ == '__main__':
179  main(sys.argv)
